entry.title: Unsolved Mysteries
entry.content:
This is a reference book redesign called ‘Unsolved Mysteries’. I found this book from a book store and then I reorganized it content; Also came out a brand new system for it. I made this book as a file format. This book was designed in two sizes. Front matters, introductions and index was designed in one size. But to hide all the stories inside of it to react to the word of ‘mysteries’.

Besides that, I added a folded poster at the end of each story. I screen shot all the evidence from online and newspaper headlines. Presenting the possibility of resolution to people historical proposition.
entry.summary: This is a reference book redesign called ‘Unsolved Mysteries’. I found this book from a book store and then I reorganized it content; Also came out a brand new system for it. I made this book as a file format. This book was designed in two sizes. Front matters, introductions and index was designed in one size. But to hide all the stories inside of it to react to the word of ‘mysteries’.

entry.title: The Culture of Gesture
entry.content: Voyage is a quarterly publication focused on highlighting and comparing traditions and social patterns of different cultures across the globe. This issue, The Culture of Gesture, highlights non-verbal communication and hand gestures in North America, China, and South Korea. Collaborated with Anne Collingwood and Hyelim Koh.
entry.summary: Voyage is a quarterly publication focused on highlighting and comparing traditions and social patterns of different cultures across the globe. This issue, The Culture of Gesture, highlights non-verbal communication and hand gestures in North America, China, and South Korea. Collaborated with Anne Collingwood and Hyelim Koh.

entry.title: 19 Rules of Typography
entry.content: This publication is developed from Rob Carter’s 19 Rules of Typography The Lexicon of Letters.And my idea for this publication was to through designing the ‘ugly type’ examples on the top but still present it beautifully to reveal 19 different rules at the bottom after people interact with 19 different triangles.
entry.summary: This publication is developed from Rob Carter’s 19 Rules of Typography The Lexicon of Letters.And my idea for this publication was to through designing the ‘ugly type’ examples on the top but still present it beautifully to reveal 19 different rules at the bottom after people interact with 19 different triangles.

entry.title: My Brain Dump since 2015
entry.content: I gathered a lot of mini projects that I’ve been working on since 2015 and these mini projects included packaging design, collages, illustrations and 3D printed objects to showcase a range of my ideation process.
entry.summary: I gathered a lot of mini projects that I’ve been working on since 2015 and these mini projects included packaging design, collages, illustrations and 3D printed objects to showcase a range of my ideation process.

entry.title: Homepage Bio
entry.content: is a graphic designer who specializes in print, publication digital media, and branding. Originally from Suzhou, China, she studied graphic design at Minneapolis College of Art and Design (2014 - 2017) and received her BFA degree from there in May 2017. Currently working and living in Minneapolis, Minnesota. PMH Advertising Agency where she currently works for. Has worked for DesignWorks and BENWU STUDIO (Shanghai/ Beijing) before.
entry.summary: is a graphic designer who specializes in print, publication digital media, and branding. Originally from Suzhou, China, she studied graphic design at Minneapolis College of Art and Design (2014 - 2017) and received her BFA degree from there in May 2017.
